news_header: The Sphinx snow patch in Scotland has melted for the fourth year in a row, attributed to climate change, while various other news highlights include job losses in Grangemouth, reflections on the independence referendum, and advancements in rehabilitation technology.
news_text: The Sphinx, believed to be the longest-lasting snow patch in the UK, has melted for the fourth consecutive year, with Iain Cameron and other experts documenting its decline as part of 'citizen science'. Researchers link the melting to climate change. In other news, 400 workers in Grangemouth face job losses, with government officials expressing confidence in finding them new employment. Reflections on the Scottish independence referendum are shared by young voters, and advancements in rehabilitation technology for stroke patients are being explored. Additionally, various cultural and community events are highlighted, including performances by local artists and discussions on child poverty.
